New Records: Brandon Lockridge hit the first home run of his career
Key Match Events: The Padres hit three home runs in the ninth inning to beat the Diamondbacks 5-0
Kyle Higashioka hit a two-run home run
Brandon Lockridge hit a solo home run
Donovan Solano hit a two-run home run
Pre-Game Insights: Padres manager Mike Schildt rested key players, including Luis Arraez and Fernando Tatis Jr.
Schildt acknowledged the fight in his club, regardless of the lineup
Post-Match Reflections: Schildt congratulated Brandon Lockridge on his first career home run
Schildt praised the team's performance, saying 'There's no question this club, regardless of who we put out there, is going to compete and play to win the game'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Diamondbacks were held to just two hits the entire night
Padres starting pitcher Randy Vasquez struck out four batters over six innings
Others: The Padres' win keeps Arizona tied for the final wild card spot heading into the final full day of the regular season Sunday
The Monday double-header between the New York Mets and the Atlanta Braves still holds massive potential to shake up the wild card standings
